p: Reducing local anthropogenic impacts may make coral reefs more resilient to climate change and OA by reducing the harmful interaction with climate change factors (see Table 1) (Hoegh‐guldberg & Bruno, 2010; Hughes et al., 2003; IGBP, 2013; Knowlton & Jackson, 2008; Pandolfi et al., 2011). Reducing local stressors also buys time for coral reef species to adapt or acclimate (Hoegh‐Guldberg, 2014), especially in more thermally resistant coral reefs with higher adaptive potential (e.g., Carilli et al., 2012), such as in the northern Red Sea and Arabian Gulf (Coles & Riegl, 2013; Fine, Gildor, & Genin, 2013).
